title: Nystagmus
summary: Nystagmus is a condition of involuntary (or voluntary, in some cases)[1] eye movement. Infants can be born with it but more commonly acquire it in infancy or later in life. In many cases it may result in reduced or limited vision.[2] Due to the involuntary movement of the eye, it has been called "dancing eyes".[3][lower-alpha 1]
